entry.title: Revert "build: Automatically AOT compile when installing official build"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3ee042e48dc858e56209d021310033ea6bc4e89e.



Reason for revert: Breaking APK targets. See:

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1521900#c2



Original change's description:

> build: Automatically AOT compile when installing official build

>

> The purpose of an official build is to be as close to what a normal

> user would get as possible. When the Play Store installs an app

> it will AOT compile the Java code. Therefore do likewise in our

> install script.

>

> The Play Store will use either the speed or speed-profile

> profile. Since speed-profile requires a profile file which we don't

> have available in the source tree, we always use speed.

>

> Bug: 1521900

> Change-Id: Ifeb977e48564413bc659c106fb582d17a553415d

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5239068

> Auto-Submit: Peter Collingbourne

> Commit-Queue: Andrew Grieve

> Reviewed-by: Andrew Grieve

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1252488}



Bug: 1521900

Change-Id: I9a2ef67068bacb37e78a53e8dff776cda9aa1f5c

No-Presubmit: true

No-Tree-Checks: true

No-Try: true

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5239053

entry.title: Rename ShoppingListHandler and move WebUI api to be a top-level resource
entry.content:
This patch migrates the shopping_list_api_proxy out of the side_panel

shared directory and into the top-level webui resource folder. This

API is already used in two side panel features and since we will be

adding another non-side panel client, we need to move it to a more

general location where it can be used by anyone that needs it.



The name of the handler has also been updated to

shopping_service_handler to better reflect that it supposed to be

the means for accessing the shopping service from webui (rather

than being for just a single feature).



Bug: b:283833590, b:312263252

Change-Id: Idd88a0fe3aad3b177c2dbf74196b21bf912d971e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5170552

Reviewed-by: Joe Mason

Reviewed-by: Rebekah Potter

Commit-Queue: Matthew Jones

Reviewed-by: Demetrios Papadopoulos

Reviewed-by: Yue Zhang

entry.title: [LCPP] Auto-preconnect to LCP origins experiment, read path.
entry.content:
This CL implements the read path of automatic-preconnect to LCP

origins experiment. Write path will follow in a separate CL.



Automatic Preconnect to LCP Origins experiments attempts to learn LCP image origins using LCPP framework, and use that information to preconnect to LCP origins using the ResourcePrefetchPredictor infrastructure. The experiment aims at executing a preconnect to the LCP origin prior to navigation, and help improve LCP of sites with a cross-origin image asset as the LCP element.



Bug: 1518996

Change-Id: Ie173ea53bf7d2d27717f1ead5e0be372592e59e6

entry.title: [tpcd] Fix ParserDeathTest and use of GTEST_SKIP
entry.content:
The failures for which these tests were disabled were due to the fact

that, for a time, official builds didn't stream the message for

CHECK(...) to the child proc's output. The fix is to use

EXPECT_CHECK_DEATH_WITH rather than ASSERT_DEATH_IF_SUPPORTED, which

does the right thing.



This CL also replaces uses of the internal GTEST_SKIP_ macro with the

public GTEST_SKIP macro.



Bug: 1478111,1517343

Change-Id: I8943e258cc5e470a54a84d1367edd8bb188c6f52

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5237417

Reviewed-by: Jonathan Njeunje

entry.title: [MagicStack] Support user configuration of UI components on Start.
entry.content:
This CL introduces a user-configurable option for home modules, allowing visibility control of all registered module types via switches. Users can toggle these switches off to hide specific modules, ensuring they remain hidden even after restarting Clank.

The configuration page will look like this: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1q4q7jMxiU0Ti-HCkT9xaM_RvmwCeV7_3/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-H7L1eKh8edjqYYD45odrIQ

entry.title: Add Data Controls OS clipboard string replacement logic
entry.content:
This CL implements the Data Controls equivalent of the

CopyPreventionSettings policy. In order to simplify later refactors,

the new ChromeContentBrowserClient::IsClipboardCopyAllowed

implementation logic is done in the enterprise_data_protection

directory.



Skip-Translation-Screenshots-Check because this string isn't displayed

in the UI. Instead, it may become visible to the user anywhere they

attempt to paste the data, including outside of Chromium.

entry.title: [boringssl] Enable usage in other chrome clients
entry.content:
Chrome's fuzztest depends on boringssl and we plan to also use

fuzztest in V8. Using the same dependencies as Chrome might make

maintenance easier in the future, hence, this prepares V8 to

depend on boringssl as well for fuzz-test usage.



We want to avoid adding other unnecessary dependencies and have

until now avoided depending on //testing/*.



Boringssl already has all references to //testing/* behind the

build_with_chromium flag, except one import, which is now

moved as well in this CL.



Referencing `enable_rust` only worked coincidentally because

rust.gni was reached through an import chain via fuzzer_test.gni.

This CL makes the import explicit.



Bug: 1500944

Change-Id: I7e5d9efcf1129a61b0a1b1b10a314f196911e321

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5237179

entry.title: EndpointFetcher: Use `base::TimeDelta` for timeout values
entry.content:
Use the strong type - `base::TimeDelta` for timeout values in

`EndpointFetcher` instead of `int64_t`. This follows the best practices

for handling time values - and eliminates potential unit conversion

bugs.

entry.title: Explicitly pass FragmentItem to TextDecorationPainter
entry.content:
Rather than binding to a FragmentItem at construction-time, pass one as

a parameter to the Begin() method. This should allow for more general

use of TextDecorationPainter since it could now potentially be used in

contexts where a FragmentItem isn't available (like for combined text).

entry.title: [anchor] Rename PositionFallbackData to OutOfFlowData
entry.content:
This prepares for the interleaving anchor() evaluation

(Issue 1510829).



For interleaving anchor(), we'll update the style from out-of-flow

layout even when position fallback isn't used, and it will be

necessary to store some invalidation information on Element

like we currently do for @try. Since this data isn't necessarily

related to position-fallback, the class is renamed.

entry.title: [sync] Add feature kSyncRememberCustomPassphraseAfterSignout
entry.content:
If a custom passphrase user signs out and back in again, they shouldn't

have to enter their passphrase again. It should get cleared only when

the account is removed from the device, or if Sync is reset from the

dashboard.



To do that, a new gaia-keyed pref will be added in coming CLs.

This CL creates a flag to control these changes. And adds a chrome flag for testing on Bling.

entry.title: Cronet experimental option: deprecate enable_socket_recv_optimization
entry.content:
I've searched in code search and this is not being used by anyone

internally. Some work affecting this is happening in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5106488

and it's not entirely clear how it will affect net when running with

this enabled (plus even if it works now, it might become worse as more

work happens). To be on the safe side, drop this option so that Cronet's

users cannot set this parameter to true and we align with Chromium's

default.

Original change's description:

> [DTC] Use TabObscuringHandler to block transition

>

> When tab strip transition happens when a scrim overs only the portion under the toolbar, there'll be a gap / overlap between the scrim to the toolbar. For those cases, tab strip transition should be blocked.

>

> TabObscuringHandler is used by several other component to indicate the tab content is blocked by some other UI e.g. TabModalDialog. This CL makes TabStripTransitionCoordinator listen to that signal to decide whether to kick off an transition.

>

> This CL also changed the timing when tab modal dialog calls #unobscur, from as soon as the dialog is dismissed, to until the exit animation is completed. This aligns with what's being done in the ScrimMediator i.e. only trigger visibility callback once scrim has alpha=0.

>

> Bug: 1519696

> Change-Id: I977a81515ce4c80df8cefe710b71a3d6ec6dcf9d

entry.title: [ios] Fix bad interaction between TabsCloser and RecentTabsMediator
entry.content:
Ensure that the original Browser's WebStateList is considered as

in the middle of a batch operation while confirming the "close all

tabs" operation.



This ensures that RecentTabsMediator wait until all the tabs are

closed before refreshing its state, avoiding lots of unnecessary

operations that can cause the watchdog to kick in and terminate

the application.



Add unit tests to check that the WebStateList is in a batch

operation while the operation is confirmed.



Fixed: 1521867

Change-Id: I9e62275c5e698b5970c0367d940e525678fa1b32

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5237379

This will help us better report errors in histograms and act differently

depending on the error type while performing state determination. We

have not yet taken advantage of the DBus error channel here and still

treat an empty list of keys as an error.

entry.title: [waffle]Center radio button disc inside initial cell content
entry.content:
We want to center the radio button disc of each search engine in the

cell content while excluding the space taken by the marketing

snippet.



We also remove the flaky "ShowSearchEngineOmnibox" pixel test.

There were 2 issues causing the test to be flaky:

1- The fake omnibox animation that happens when we click on a

radio button is causing some flakiness. This issue can be solved

by setting the animation duration to 0s in the test.

2- Clicking on a radio button causes some type of animation to

show the user that the button is clicked. The animation is that a

small layer of the color blue covers the radio button for a small

period of time. We can't disable this in the pixel test.



Fixed: 1521321, b:320627854

Change-Id: If25eb76d938c457d215f6f0d36e7cfb264b2f0d0

entry.title: [Sync][Android] Call keepAccountSettingsPrefsOnlyForUsers synchronously
entry.content:
Prior to this CL, keepSettingsOnlyForAccountManagerAccounts was

using Promise.then to call keepAccountSettingsPrefsOnlyForUsers with

the list of accounts. This was causing flakiness in some tests

(for example, SingleClientReadingListSyncTest), especially if

account seeding happens quickly (e.g., with SeedAccountsRevamp

enabled). See https://crbug.com/1517263#c28 for details of the

flakiness scenario. This CL addresses the issue by calling

keepAccountSettingsPrefsOnlyForUsers synchronously from

onCoreAccountInfosChanged.



Bug: 1517263

entry.title: Fix LCPPLazyLoadImagePreload feature to recort lcp element locator info
entry.content:
This is a bug fix CL.



Before this CL, the element locator info was not stored at all to the

LCPP database even if the LCPPLazyLoadImagePreload feature was enabled.

It's stored only when LCPCriticalPathPredictor feature is enabled.



This CL changes `OnLargestContentfulPaintUpdated()` to record the

element locator info when LCPPLazyLoadImagePreload is enabled.

entry.title: Raise if the fetch-event source is used without a fetch handler.
entry.content:
This is CL implements:

https://github.com/yoshisatoyanagisawa/ServiceWorker/pull/2



Upon the PR, TypeError is thrown if the fetch-event source is used

without having a fetch handler in the service worker script.

Note that an empty fetch handler is thought as a fetch handler

existence because a web developer actually implements the fetch

handler. It means that if the fetch-event source is set with an

empty fetch handler, `addRoutes()` returns promise success.



Additional fix:

- Promise reject was not returned even if the conversion failed.

Therefore, the AddRoutes mojo call was called unexpectedly.

The behavior has been fixed.



Bug: 1511459

Change-Id: I0197ab55a223b03c8e6ca8e46e9a16d461d9bc9c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5233688

entry.content:

10%.

is no longer needed. (It indicates the color space of the primary

plane, but we now pass the color space for each plane in the overlay

parameters).

entry.title: [sharing] Avoid unique_ptr when dealing with target devices
entry.content:
No behavioral changes, pure refactoring.



As per TODO tackled in this patch, there is no good reason to wrap

instances of SharingTargetDeviceInfo with unique_ptr. The class is

relatively small and making it movable serves a similar purpose.

Avoiding pointers makes the code simpler and more readable.



In APIs where nullptr was used to represent lookup failure,

std::optional is now adopted.

Fixed: b/316374607

entry.title: [bookmarks] Delete unused model meta-info-map
entry.content:
This patch deletes code that appears to have been unused for a long

time, possibly forever.



The unused code implemented a meta-info map (arbitrary set of attributes

represented as key-value pairs) that, instead of being part of a

bookmark node (e.g. see BookmarkNode::GetMetaInfo()), is interpreted as

belonging the BookmarkModel itself. In truth, it was anyway loaded into

the synthetic BookmarkNode instance that is the root node, as exposed by

BookmarkModel::root_node().



This code cleanup simplifies having to reason about model-level

attributes if multiple JSON files are used to persist the model

(currently being considered) but is regardless considered a good thing

to remove unused code without plans to use it anytime soon.



Change-Id: I7410a04152a46e0ae61790fb6bd9e7083b021263

Bug: 1520418

entry.title: [Autofill] Rewrite AutofillRendererTest (the one in //chrome)
entry.content:
This CL rewrites the entire test. This is necessary for

crrev.com/c/5237014, which removes the Mojo message

SetFormToBeProbablySubmitted(). This removal affected the test

in the strangest ways (see below).



Before this CL, the test fixture hacked its own version of

EXPECT_CALL(). It was buggy in a few ways:



- WaitForFormsSeen() misbehaved if the awaited event had already

happened before the call; i.e., it relied on events being slow

enough.

- The test triggered multiple FormsSeen() events and implicitly

ignored some of them. This only worked as long as the entirely

unrelated Mojo message SetFormToBeProbablySubmitted() was sent.

Removing this event broke the test in the strangest way. I assume

the only worked because it was implicitly relying on some

implementation details of Mojo.

- The third test case only worked when run in //chrome/test/data.



Bug: 1007974, 1117451

Change-Id: Icd24b69fdc70d4f15db5eafcc644c7f5c5475b78

entry.title: Support the ‚Äòavc1‚Äô and ‚Äòmp4a‚Äô names for MP4 container.
entry.content:
Following the guidelines in the web media specification.

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Media/Formats/codecs_parameter.



According to the specification, the codec naming should use ‚Äòavc1‚Äô

instead of ‚Äòh264‚Äô and ‚Äòmp4a.40.2‚Äô instead of ‚Äòaac-LC‚Äô.

The ‚Äòavc1‚Äô format can have 6 hex digits that identify the profile,

flags, and level, while the ‚Äòmp4a‚Äô format can have an OTI value

like ‚Äòmp4a.40.2‚Äô.



During the isSupportedType validation, only the major name

like ‚Äòavc1‚Äô and ‚Äòmp4a‚Äô should be validated, similar to h

ow vp8/vp9 or mp4 is validated in Safari.



This change will not support ‚Äòh264‚Äô and ‚Äòaac‚Äô for the mp4 container,

but it will not update the existing webm side where ‚Äòh264‚Äô is supported.



Bug: 1517949

entry.title: Add feature to enable baked-in gamut mapping of oklab and oklch
entry.content:
This feature changes the behavior of blink::Color::toSkColor4f to

always apply gamut mapping after converting oklab or oklch to an

SkColor4f.



Add a separate function blink::Color::ToGradientStopSkColor4f,

which does not gamut map (if interpolating in oklab or oklch space),

because this is used to round-trip from oklab to SkColor4 back to

oklab.



Add the pile of math for polyhedral approximation of gamut mapping

to the helper function OklabGamutMap. This will map to an

approximation of the rec2020 gamut (for now).

entry.title: Reland "Bugfix: Stop the warmed-up service worker correctly"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 73272464b7e9ca8c25fd751e4309cce8eab6b3d3



Before this CL, when the warmed-up service worker is stopping, we run

all start_callbacks_ to tell that we don't need to restart the service

worker. But it caused crashes because

scoped_refptr were dereferenced from

start_callbacks_. I'm still not sure why start_callbacks_ is the only

reference of the registration.



This CL is a speculative fix of this crash by delaying running

start_callbacks_ until FinishStartWorker() is called in

ServiceWorkerVersion::OnStoppedInternal().



Original change's description:

> Bugfix: Stop the warmed-up service worker correctly

>

> Before this CL, when the warmed-up service worker is requested to stop,

> the service worker surprisingly starts instead of stopping. This CL

> fixes this bug.

>

> The bug was located in the ServiceWorkerVersion. Before this CL,

> start_callbacks_ contained remaining callbacks while the service worker

> was warming up or warmed up. These remaining callbacks are checked in

> ServiceWorkerVersion::OnStoppedInternal() like the following.

>

> bool should_restart = !start_callbacks_.empty();

>

> The should_restart flag becomes true, and the service worker is

> restarted. This CL fixes this problem by flushing callbacks beforehand.

>

> Bug: 1431792

> Change-Id: Id9a6f143ab7c93178f7183e6ed0509c486dda9c2

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5224881

> Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

> Commit-Queue: Minoru Chikamune

entry.title: Reland: Prerender: Do not invoke show/unload events on prerender cancellation
entry.content:
This is a reland attempt of crrev.com/c/5198952.

The CL re-enables some disabled tests that are not directly related

to the change, but can start working with this fix. But unfortunately

these tests seem flaky especially on mac.



So, one of the diffs from the original CL is the change for

TextExpectations. Original CL removed skip configuration, but now

they are changed to have mac only failure marks.

Note that the failure doesn't come from this change, but from the

test infra as of observed results, out of order expectation messages.



Also, this change reverts the change for pagehide to be aligned

with the direction of unload event direction, delivering pagehide

always before the page termination instead of unload.



Original description follows:

> As it's hard for prerendered pages to ensure triggering events on

> cancellation, we decided not to trigger unload events on cancellation.

> Also, show/hide should not be triggered while prerendering, but these

> are unexpected dispatched before the unload events.

>

> This CL adds explicit code to omit their handling to make the behavior

> stable.

>

> Bug: 1222551, 1289245

> Change-Id: I1fadd635c8b5e9da8dacc9258e74b10360852748

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5198952

entry.title: media/cast: Allow video encoders to drop a frame
entry.content:
By dropping a frame, in the case of bitrate overshoot, a frame quality

will be improved but also the transmission delay will be mitigated.

It doesn't matter to drop a frame occasionally in cast mirroring.

However, the user expectation about drop frame rate is higher in cast

mirroring than WebRTC. I set the weaker drop frame threshold (=10),

than WebRTC (=30).

The drop frame feature is behind CastVideoEncoderFrameDrop and

disabled by default.



Design doc: go/frame-drop-VEA



Bug: b:280363228

Test: Cast mirroring on atlas



Change-Id: I585367104d1dfbcf868b9f05a90994b9c9f33275

entry.title: Remove WebPreference control ::-webkit-scrollbar* from parsing
entry.content:
This change removes most of the code added via CL:3822241.



Specifically, the logic to "disable" scrollbar styling via ::webkit

prefixed pseudo elements is removed from the parsing stage. Logic to

"disable" scrollbar styling from ::webkit prefixed pseudos and CSS

ScrollbarColor and ScrollbarWidth properties will be added to the

styling stage in a subsequent change. Moving this logic to styling

allows for invalidation of the scrollbar styles when a user chooses to

disable scrollbar styling.



This change also renames the associated web preference from

"enable_webkit_scrollbar_styling" to

"prefers_default_scrollbar_styling" since this more accurately reflects

the preference that the user will be able to control via web setting in

a subsequent change.



Bug: 1012117

Change-Id: I702dc2733f089a9e3dccc7743b4cbd1fe7870327

entry.title: fingerprint: Adjust switch case logic
entry.content:
With the current switch case logic, it is difficult to update biod

system_api protos. system_api changes are upreved through regular rolls,

but then we have to fix the build failure caused by missing enum entries

in the uprev CL.



We should instead have the default case crash on receiving an unexpected

variant, instead of causing build to fail. The correct update sequence

should then be:

1. Update system_api proto in CrOS. Usage of new protos can be

introduced, but they can't actually be used for communication

between Chrome/CrOS yet as Chrome don't know how to handle them and

will crash.

2. Update Chrome code to handle the new proto variants after system_api

uprev.

3. After CrOS is shipped with new enough chrome version that includes

2., the new proto variants can be used for communication between

Chrome/CrOS.



Bug: b:321876084

Test: CQ

Change-Id: Icb053a20bc97459610caff0788eeecae6487248c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5223625

entry.title: build: Automatically AOT compile when installing official build
entry.content:
The purpose of an official build is to be as close to what a normal

user would get as possible. When the Play Store installs an app

it will AOT compile the Java code. Therefore do likewise in our

install script.



The Play Store will use either the speed or speed-profile

profile. Since speed-profile requires a profile file which we don't

have available in the source tree, we always use speed.



Bug: 1521900

entry.title: Fix GPU zero copy expectations
entry.content:
Fixes how the GPU trace tests compute whether the zero copy path is

expected to be used or not. The same logic was used for all GPUs, which

resulted in many failing tests since the logic was originally written to

only support Intel.



Now, each GPU can specify when it supports the zero copy path.

entry.title: Cleanup, optimize, and improve SoftwareVideoEncoderTest.
entry.content:
This improves memory pressure and switches the test to use a real

four colors frame instead of single color. Creating the four colors

frame is more expensive, so tests are optimized to improve frame

pool reuse. The new version is faster than the old by a hair (~2%).



As part of this the code for generating a four colors test frame

is moved to our media test helpers pass w/ a new feature: optional

color mask so variants of the four color frame can be produced.



This is all in prep of adding 4:4:4 encoding tests for vp9, av1.



R=eugene



Bug: 1378115

Change-Id: Ic0004160a606602e95454df693e412906f4d5600

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5239212

entry.title: [SafetyCheck] Revoke unused chooser permissions.
entry.content:
This change adds chooser permissions support for Safety Hub flow by

handling WebsiteSettings, in addition to ContentSettings that are

already supported. Unlike ContentSettings that can be restored by

setting CONTENT_SETTING_ALLOW, WebsiteSettings needs corresponding

base::Value to be stored together, in order to support regranting.



Revoked permission data stored in website setting now includes

additional base::Value::Dict for storing chooser permission data,

which is used for restoring. The existing ContentSettingsType list

includes chooser permission types, in addition to regular permissions.

entry.title: Revert "Eliminate ReportQueueProvider::GetInstance duplication."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5a2871c85c803771d8ad1ceb11ef9b8ec22d40b2.



Reason for revert: ReportQueueProviderTest.CreateMultipleSpeculativeQueues became flaky



Original change's description:

> Eliminate ReportQueueProvider::GetInstance duplication.

>

> Fixing the link error that logged an error:

> `ReportQueueProducer::GetInstance` being a duplicate (defined in

> `ReportClient` and in `TestEnvironment`). Apparently, some changes in

> BUILDs made it possible to have both browser and TestEnvironment

> in the same binary.

>

> Instead of forwarding GetInstance from ReportQueueProvider to

> ReportClient and generate singleton instance there, let browser

> own and register it. Some tests and test environments are modified

> accordingly.

>

> Now we no longer need to declare ReportQueueProvider::GetInstance

> in tests, and no duplication takes place.

>

> Tested by unit tests and by manual VM run.

>

entry.title: Support enabling MojoIpcz by environment variable
entry.content:
A large number of Mojo consumers on ChromeOS do not initialize or use

base FeatureList and therefore cannot control MojoIpcz via features.



Additionally we need to ensure that every Mojo binary running on the

system is using the same Mojo implementation.



This adds support for a MOJO_IPCZ environment variable to force-enable

MojoIpcz when set to 1, allowing for a global system-wide switch to

MojoIpcz.

entry.title: HTTPS-First Mode: Count non-unique hostnames as fallback events
entry.content:
HTTPS-First Mode and HTTPS Upgrades treat non-unique hostnames

differently: On a non-unique hostname, HFM will display an interstitial.

However, HTTPS-Upgrades will not attempt an upgrade in the first place.



The Typically Secure User heuristic enables HFM when certain conditions

are satisfied. One of these conditions is the number of HTTPS-Upgrade

fallback counts being lower than a certain threshold over a week.



We presently don't count non-unique hostnames as fallback events. As a

result, we may auto-enable HFM due to the Typically Secure User

heuristic and start showing interstitials on non-unique hostnames.

Non-unique hostnames are common in enterprise settings, so this would

show a lot of interstitials in enterprise environments.



This CL counts non-unique hostnames as fallback events so that we don't

auto-enable HFM due to the Typically Secure heuristic.

entry.title: [Per-App Language] Verify locale tag is in a valid IETF BCP 47 format
entry.content:
ARC has been using Java Locale lib to parse user-generated locale_tag,

which is based on IETF BCP 47, and will return "und" on invalid ones.

However, to guard Chrome from cases where ARC is compromised, we'll also

add another layer of check when we receive the input from mojom, to

ensure that any locale we passed downstream (app_service, prefs, UI) are

all using valid strings

entry.title: Mojo: Fix race in data pipe trap behavior
entry.content:
The bug:



When the IO thread receives data pipe updates from out-of-process, it

may begin to dispatch a corresponding Mojo trap event. The relevant trap

is partially updated, some bookkeeping is done, and then the event is

dispatched.



In the interim another thread may change the pipe's state and render

it uninteresting to the pending event, causing the IO thread to

ultimately suppress the event rather than dispatch it. Once it's

finished processing, the IO thread disarms the trap in any case.



Because the trap itself remains armed during this window, if another

thread attempts to re-arm the trap before the IO thread is finished

disarming the trap, re-arming will appear redundant and will early-out

without actually ensuring that the trap is ready to catch a new state

change.



This can leave the application stuck in a state where it no longer

receives notifications about available data on the pipe because it

thinks it's watching when it's not.



The fix:



Stop suppressing events that appear spurious, since they aren't

necessarily so. This is behind a feature flag (enabled by default)

so we can Finch for performance evaluation.



Fixed: 1468933

Fixed: b:289971807

Change-Id: I0f4c0309aa9987fadefa281579820a0533e3d11c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5231643

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

entry.title: Revert "Get rid of RunUntilIdle in tests"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4239a13e4bbf1e7cf1f5e40d89b2d5bfec4cd4c7.



Reason for revert: Chained to a culprit cl crrev.com/c/5201547



Original change's description:

> Get rid of RunUntilIdle in tests

>

> We need to make sure delete-on-thread happens before test fixture

> completes, when the respective object is a mock (test storage or report

> queue producer). In prod code delete-on-thread is necessary, while in

> tests it is assigned to the current task runner, and so instead of

> posting the deletion task and waiting, we can just use std::unique_ptr and thus release and delete the mock object on the main thread.

>

> After that RunUntilIdle becomes unnecessary - the tests succeed without

> it (removal is done in the tests that were recently modified; now they

> are reverted back, but there might be more tests that can be cleaned up

> this way).

>

> Bug: b:314195198
